title: The X Factor: Celebrity's Ben Foden reveals he will ask ex Una Healy to attend live shows
text:
He split from his popstar wife in 2018 before remarrying a woman he had been dating for just two weeks in August 2019.

But Ben Foden has revealed that he plans to invite ex wife Una Healy to attend the live shows of The X Factor: Celebrity, alongside new spouse Jackie Belanoff-Smith.

Speaking at the press launch of the show on Wednesday, the rugby player, 34, competing in band Try Star with fellow sportsman Thom Evans and Levi Davis, said he hopes Saturdays singer Una, 37, will support his musical endeavours.

Ok then: Ben Foden has revealed that he plans to invite ex wife Una Healy to attend the live shows of The X Factor: Celebrity, alongside new spouse Jackie Belanoff-Smith (above with Una in 2017)

He said: 'Obviously my kids [will come], I’d love to get them down to the show. Err, I’ll ask Una whether she’ll come or not, and then we’ll see. Obviously my wife will come as well and she’ll support me.’

When grilled further about whether his near-decade long romance with Una had helped him when preparing for the reality show, he said: ‘Una was always really supportive of me doing singing and stuff.

'I did shows. I did singing on All Together Now and League Of Their Own, and Una was always very supportive of me doing that.

‘She’d always, like, coach me a little bit. But she doesn’t have very much patience with me because I’m not the best singer.

Whirlwind: Ben hit the headlines in August when he tied the knot with Jackie just two weeks after they first began dating

'And, she’d be like: “do this” and I’m like “I don’t know what that is,” and she’d be like: “everyone knows what that is in the singing industry”.’

‘So, it’s been great for us to go and actually work with real vocal coaches and learn how to harmonize and learn all the serious sides about being in a band together.

‘So I did get the tiniest fraction of a little bit of head start. But we all have individual starts: Levi comes from a musical school, Tom was in a boyband back in 1964.’

Ben also laughed off the idea of receiving negative criticism on the band's performance, saying: 'I’m used to it.’

The hunk also discussed the revealing outfit he wore for his performance, explaining his nerve caused him expose more of his torso.

Band: Speaking at the press launch of the show on Wednesday, the rugby player, 34, competing in band Try Star with fellow sportsman Thom Evans and Levi Davis, said he hopes Saturdays singer Una, 37, will support his musical endeavours

Family: He said: 'Obviously my kids [will come], I’d love to get them down to the show. Err, I’ll ask Una whether she’ll come or not, and then we’ll see' (pictured 2017)

He said: ‘The longer the night went on and the more nervous I got, the more buttons I undid. And when I heard people sing I was like “Oh my god they’re so good, we’re gonna need something else here.”

I tried to encourage these two but they wouldn’t join in. That’s why I got down to one (button). I had one left.’

The candid comments about his ex comes days after Ben asked for Una's forgiveness after making 'the biggest mistake' by cheating on her.

Speaking to The Sun on Saturday, the rugby player admitted that he hoped the singer would forgive him for his infidelity during their marriage.

He said candidly: 'I hope Una will forgive me. I made the biggest mistake and the most ­stupid mistake you can make in a relationship.

Support: When grilled further about whether his near-decade long romance with Una had helped him when preparing for the reality show, he said: ‘Una was always really supportive of me doing singing and stuff (pictured 2017)

'We seemed like a perfect match but people never know what happens behind closed doors. I think it’s safe to say that Una and I were struggling for a number of years.'

Ben added that cheating on her was 'the final nail in the coffin' of their marriage.

Una and Ben married in Ireland in 2012 after four years of dating. They welcomed daughter Aoife shortly before they got married, and son Tadhg in 2015.

In February, he admitted cheating on Una, telling The Guardian: 'At the moment anything that’s published about me is never very good and pretty rightly so because I was the one who committed adultery.

'At the same time, it wasn’t the only reason for our divorce to go through. It’s not ideal, but we’re very amicable, we’re getting through it, we’re not the first people in the world to get divorced. We’ve got two little kids we adore.'

Awkward: He added: 'Obviously my wife will come as well and she’ll support me'

Ben's tattered reputation suffered a further blow in 2018 after he used dating app Bumble to publicly announce his separation from the former The Saturdays star.

The couple confirmed their separation after six years of marriage in July last year, following his alleged affair with PR girl Becky Milne.

Ben hit the headlines again in August when he tied the knot with Jackie just two weeks after they first began dating.

The star made the announcement on his Instagram account and revealed that he had received Una's blessing for the marriage.

A week after the nuptials, Ben reunited with his son and daughter as he gushed that 'the only thing that matters is family.'

Amid an array of claims arising about Ben's dating activities prior to marrying Jackie, the rugby player's pal insisted he wasn't faithful during the start of their still-fledgling romance.

The insider told MailOnline: 'He was 100% seeing Jackie at the same time as [former Big Brother contestant] Rebecca Jane and the other women. He's probably done this [married her] for a green card to stay in the US.'

Happier times: The candid comments about his ex comes days after Ben asked for Una's forgiveness after making 'the biggest mistake' by cheating on her (pictured May 2018)

The insider added: 'Before he married Jackie, he and Rebecca Jane talked about having children and it was completely ruled out.

'They discussed it at length and he definitely wasn't interested in having anymore kids.

'But, I wouldn't be surprised if he does with this latest turn of events. His posts with his kids on Saturday are just a blatant attempt to repair his image and for attention.'

The celebrity line up is Megan McKenna, 27, The Islanders - made up of Love Island 2018 contestants Wes Nelson, 21, Zara McDermott, 22, Samira Mighty and Eyal Booker, 24, Ricki Lake, 51, Hayley Hasselhoff, 27, The Chase star Jenny Ryan, 37, Cole & Edwards - made up of Strictly star - Brendan Cole, 43 and actor Jeremy Edwards, 48, Glee star Kevin McHale, 31.

Only recently, in an interview ahead of the launch, Simon revealed the reason why he decided to revamp the normal show into a celebrity version.

'It just felt so obvious to do a celebrity version', he explained. 'The only condition was I couldn’t know who was going to be on it. I said to the team, "You’ve got to find some acts who you believe can sell records off the back of this, because if you don’t do that it won’t work."

'So that was the deal and we stuck to it. I swear to God I didn’t have a clue who any of the acts were. I did walk away thinking, “If we’re smart, we have artists here who could actually sell records off the back of this”. So I thought that was fun and very exciting for the show.'

The music boss also shared how he felt about holding the auditions in his own back garden.

He said: 'When we filmed it that night it didn’t feel like work. I loved every second of it. I said to the producers, “If this really doesn’t work, we will have to re-audition for the show. That’s the deal.”

'So the fact that I felt we didn’t need to was just great. I found it interesting and fun, and doing this version of the show has also given me the chance to do All Stars. I’ve wanted to make the best of the best version of The X Factor for a long, long time. It’s been brilliant. I’ve loved every minute.'

This series, like the civilian version, will see the acts split into three groups; the overs, the unders and the groups.

The X Factor: Celebrity starts Saturday 12th October 8:35pm on ITV.
